nodes.text: Superweapons or megaweapons were weapons of extremely devastating power, ranging from the capacity to destroy a city to entire planets.

A superweapon (also spelled super-weapon) or megaweapon referred to a weapon of great power, capable of bringing varying degrees of massive destruction. Some may level whole cities and continents, whilst some could even destroy planets.
A type of superweapon was the superlaser. These were laser-based superweapons.
Superweapons were used in ancient wars between the Jedi and the Sith. Retold in legends, superweapons of the Sith were powered by massive kyber crystals.
One such weapon existed on the Sith planet Malachor, the site of an ancient battle.
The Sith Lord Darth Momin also constructed a superweapon, one with the ability to raze an entire city. He used this weapon to destroy a city before he and his acolytes were defeated by the Jedi.

The Subjugator-class heavy cruiser Malevolence used by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars was considered to be a superweapon, as was the defoliator and the Galactic Republic's electro-proton bomb developed by Sionver Boll.
The Galactic Empire created, or was believed to have devised and possibly made, many other types of superweapons:
Imperial Admiral Conan Antonio Motti loved technology that created devastating superweapons, specifically the Death Star project, which consisted of a superlaser.
The Arc Pulse Generator, invented by former Imperial Sabine Wren, was classified as a superweapon.

The Galactic Empire developed and produced, or was rumored to have, many other superweapon projects. Such include the Onager-class Star Destroyer, was a type of capital ship that utilized a kyber crystal superweapon; The rumored Mass Shadow Generator, which would have existed in both realspace and hyperspace; The Torpedo Sphere, a siege platform and space station; The Omega Frost, a rumored interstellar freeze ray; and the Electro-Proton Bomb/Defoliator, based off the electro-proton bomb and the defoliator from the Clone Wars.

Earlier versions of the 2015 film Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens had the Resistance developing a superweapon known as the War-Hammer. In those versions, the War-Hammer would've been several times the size of a Star Destroyer and had the form of a massive ship with a huge front that could penetrate any shield and was able to deploy ships through it.
